senses.definition: the part of the body below the chest that contains the stomach, bowels, etc.

senses.definition: a piece of equipment made of wire or long straight pieces of metal for receiving or sending radio and television signals

senses.definition: a small insect that eats other insects, especially ants, which it catches in a hole made in the sand
a very small insect that is harmful to plants. There are several types of aphid, including, for example, greenfly.
any small creature of the class that includes spiders, scorpions, mites and ticks
an invertebrate animal such as an insect, spider or crab, that has its skeleton on the outside of its body and has joints on its legs
a small flat insect that lives especially in beds, where it bites people and drinks their blood
a black and yellow flying insect that can sting (= touch your skin and make you feel a sharp pain).Bees live in large groups and make honey (= a sweet sticky substance that is good to eat).

a bee sting

senses.definition: a meeting in a group where people combine work, competition and pleasure

senses.definition: an insect, often large and black, with a hard case on its back, covering its wings. There are several types of beetle.

examples.x: a black beetle

senses.definition: a small black or dark green insect that damages plants
a small black fly that bites humans and animals and drinks their blood
a poisonous American spider. The female black widow often eats the male.
an insect that damages cotton plants
a poisonous brown N. American spider that has a dark brown mark on its head

senses.definition: any small insect

senses.definition: an illness that is usually fairly mild but spreads easily from person to person disease

senses.definition: an enthusiastic interest in something such as a sport or a hobby

senses.definition: a fault in a machine, especially in a computer system or program

senses.definition: a small hidden device for listening to other people’s conversations

senses.definition: a flying insect with a long thin body and four large, usually brightly coloured, wings

senses.definition: a swimming stroke in which you swim on your front and lift both arms forward at the same time while your legs move up and down together

examples.x: She was third in the 200m butterfly (= a swimming race).

senses.definition: to make a continuous low sound

senses.definition: to make a sound like a bee buzzing

senses.definition: to be full of excitement, activity, etc.

senses.definition: to call somebody to come by pressing a buzzer

senses.definition: to fly very close to somebody/something, especially as a warning or threat
a small insect. The young forms, called caddis worms, are often used for catching fish.
a small creature like a worm with legs that develops into a butterfly or moth (= flying insects with large, sometimes brightly coloured, wings). Caterpillars eat the leaves of plants. catkin
a small creature like an insect, with a long thin body and many legs
a small flea that lives in tropical regions and lays eggs under a person’s or an animal’s skin, causing painful areas on the skin
the young form of a butterfly while it is changing into an adult inside a hard case, also called a chrysalis

a large insect with transparent wings, common in hot countries. The male makes a continuous high sound after dark by making two membranes (= pieces of thin skin) on its body vibrate (= move very fast).

examples.x: Cicadas buzzed in the heat of the day.

a large brown insect with wings, that lives in houses, especially where there is dirt cock

a flying insect with very long legs

senses.definition: a very small creature that bites humans and animals and drinks their blood. There are several types of tick, some of which can carry diseases.

examples.x: a tick bite

senses.definition: a short, light, regularly repeated sound, especially that of a clock or watch

examples.x: The only sound was the soft tick of the clock.
The loud tick of the hall clock kept me awake.

senses.definition: a moment

examples.x: Hang on a tick!
I'll be with you in two ticks.

senses.definition: the poisonous liquid that some snakes, spiders, etc. produce when they bite or sting you

examples.x: The snake injects the venom immediately after biting its prey.
Centipedes kill their prey by injecting venom into them with a large pair of fangs.
Snake venoms work in several ways.

senses.definition: a strong, bitter feeling; feelings of hate and a desire to hurt somebody

examples.x: His voice was full of venom.
a look of pure venom

senses.definition: a black and yellow flying insect that can sting weave

examples.x: a wasp sting
a wasps’ nest

senses.definition: an insect which moves quickly across the surface of water
a system for finding information on the internet, in which documents are connected to other documents receive/​get/​open

examples.x: to surf/browse/search the web
The service is available to anyone with access to the web.
I found the information on the Web.
I did a Web search to find the best price.
a web browser/server

senses.definition: a fine net of thread made by a spider to catch insects

examples.x: A spider had spun a perfect web outside the window.

senses.definition: a complicated pattern of things that are closely connected to each other

examples.x: a web of streets
We were caught in a tangled web of relationships.
She discovered a web of intrigue in the company.

senses.definition: a piece of skin that joins the toes of some birds and animals that swim, for example ducks and frogs
a small insect with a hard shell, that eats grain, nuts and other seeds and destroys crops
a small white insect that damages plants

examples.x: The spray is used to control whitefly.
Check the backs of the leaves for whiteflies.

senses.definition: a small grey creature like an insect, with a hard shell, that lives in decaying wood or wet soil
a small worm that eats wood, making a lot of small holes in it
the damage caused by woodworms

examples.x: The beams are riddled with woodworm.

senses.definition: a long, thin creature with a soft body and no bones or legs

examples.x: birds looking for worms
Worms burrow down through the soil.

senses.definition: long, thin creatures that live inside the bodies of humans or animals and can cause illness

examples.x: The dog has worms.

senses.definition: the young form of an insect when it looks like a short worm

examples.x: This apple is full of worms.

senses.definition: a computer program that is a type of virus and that spreads across a network by copying itself
a person you do not like or respect, especially because they have a weak character and do not behave well towards other people
